meanings.definition: A narrow part of a body of water, such as a strait or channel.
meanings.sent1: The boat sailed through the narrows between the cliffs.
meanings.sent2: The narrows of the river were difficult to navigate.
meanings.sent3: The fisherman caught a big fish in the narrows of the lake.
meanings.sent4: The narrows of the canyon echoed with the sound of rushing water.
meanings.sent5: The narrows were a natural gateway to the open sea.

meanings.sent1: As the path narrows, it becomes harder to walk side by side.
meanings.sent2: The road narrows as it approaches the mountain pass.
meanings.sent3: The gap between the trees narrows as you move deeper into the forest.
meanings.sent4: Her focus narrows as she zeroes in on the target.
meanings.sent5: The river narrows as it flows through the canyon, creating rapids.

meanings.sent1: She narrows the opening of the box to fit the lid perfectly.
meanings.sent2: The tailor narrows the waist of the dress to create a more flattering silhouette.
meanings.sent3: He narrows the path with rocks to guide hikers in the right direction.
meanings.sent4: The architect narrows the hallway to create a sense of intimacy.
meanings.sent5: The chef narrows the sauce to intensify the flavor.
